task.title: Installing IBM Sametime Connect on Windows in silent mode
task.shortdesc: You install the IBM Sametime Connect Client on Microsoft Windows in silent mode by using two files that are provided with the client installation kit.

context.p: The silentinstall.ini file contains configuration parameters for the IBM Sametime Connect client. The settings are used to prepopulate the community-config.xml file with server connection information and other parameters required by the installer.

step.cmd: Copy the setup.bat and the silentinstall.ini files from the root of the download, and then update them to meet your requirements.

info.p: The batch file (setup.bat) contains several different commands that can be used to perform different installation functions. Some of the commands are commented out by default but can be uncommented and updated if the function is needed. Detailed explanations are included in the setup.bat file.
The commands in the setup.bat file contains configuration parameters, which are described in Table 1.

table.title: IBM Sametime Connect command line parameters in the setup.bat file

row.entry: Parameter
Description
The name of the log file created by the installer. The file is created in the same directory as the installer.
Full path to the desired installation directory.
Name of the silentinstall.ini file.
Must be TRUE for silent execution.
Instructs the installer to migrate connection settings from an existing pre-7.5 version of IBM Sametime.

Set to YES to indicate acceptance of the license agreement. This must be specified on the command-line when the silentinstall.ini file is not used. When silentinstall.ini is used, LAPAGREE is set in that file.

info.p: The commands in the silentinstall.ini file contains configuration parameters, which are described in Table 2.

row.entry: Parameter
Description
You must change this parameter to YES to indicate acceptance of the license agreement.

When set to true, this parameter creates a community-config.xml file. If you use a custom plugin_customization.ini file to set initial preferences that are unique to your site or to add custom features, change this value to false to ensure that your custom settings are honored.
Fully qualified host name of the IBM Sametime Community Server. Normally this should be the same as the home server specified in the Person document.
Community name
IBM Sametime Community Server IP port number
Flag for sending keep-alive signal.
Default is 60 seconds. Indicates how often to check the connectivity between the client and server, allowing timely notification if disconnected.
Connection type

entry.codeph: STPROXYHOST=Proxy port number (leave blank if not used)

row.entry: IBM Sametime Proxy host name (leave blank if not used)
IBM Sametime Proxy port number (leave blank if not used)
IBM Sametime Proxy resolves local flag (TRUE/FALSE)
IBM Sametime Proxy user name (leave blank if not used)
IBM Sametime Proxy password (leave blank if not used)

entry.p:
Specify one of the language codes to set the language used by the IBM Sametime Connect client. If not specified, the client computer's default language is used.
cs - Czech
da - Danish
de - German
el - Greek
en - English
es - Spanish
fi - Finnish
fr - French
hu - Hungarian
it - Italian
ja - Japanese
ko - Korean
nl - Dutch
nb - Norwegian
pl - Polish
pt - Portuguese (Portugal)
pt_BR - Portuguese (Brazil)
ru - Russian
sv - Swedish
tr - Turkish
zh_CN - Chinese (simplified)
zh_TW - Chinese (traditional)

row.entry:
Specifies the URL of the Auth Server for SSO Token Login (leave blank if not used)
See Configuring single sign-on with Microsoft Windows Active Directory for additional information.
Login By Token flag. TRUE/FALSE
Use Auth Server flag. TRUE/FALSE
Login at startup flag. TRUE/FALSE

entry.p: Uninstall Sametime clients older than release 7.5:

step.cmd: Copy the updated files to the user's computer.
Run the silent install with the following command: setup.bat -silentinstall.ini
